Alternate Weekday Service Plan Beginning Friday, September 30 For Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Line Customers

NJ TRANSIT rail service remains suspended in and out of Hoboken due to a train accident at Hoboken station. Metro-North will provide an alternate weekday service plan beginning Friday, September 30 until further notice that will include Bus Service Options: Limited shuttle bus service to the Hudson Line will operate for Metro-North customers during rush hour peak direction only from Middletown, Harriman and Palisades Center Park & Ride in West Nyack. Ferry Service Options: Some parking is available for Metro-North customers at the two Metro-North ferry services (Newburgh-Beacon & Haverstraw-Ossining Ferry ) that connect with our Hudson Line. Parking Options: Some parking is available at Metro-North's Cortlandt Station on the Hudson Line and North White Plains Station on the Harlem Line. Metro-North will cross-honor West of Hudson Metro-North tickets on the Hudson & Harlem Lines and the ferry services. Other Options: Use existing bus services: From Rockland the Tappan ZEExpress; from Orange County use the Newburgh Beacon Shuttle. See full plan details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/NJTRANSIT_accident.htm Please also visit the NJTRANSIT website at www.njtransit.com for the latest Port Jervis Line & Pascack Valley Line train service information.

September 29 Alternate Bus Service for Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Line Customers

NJ TRANSIT rail service remains suspended in and out of Hoboken due to a train accident at Hoboken station. Metro-North will provide alternate bus service during the PM Peak on Thursday, September 29 for Pascack Valley Line and Port Jervis Line customers as follows: For Pascack Valley Line and Port Jervis Line customers traveling to Suffern, Sloatsburg, Tuxedo, Harriman and Salisbury Mills: Take Hudson Line train service to Tarrytown Station for connecting bus service to Pearl River, Nanuet and Spring Valley on the Pascack Valley Line and Suffern, Sloatsburg, Tuxedo, Harriman and Salisbury Mills on the Port Jervis Line. Buses will meet trains departing Grand Central Terminal between 3:43 PM and 8:33 PM. For Port Jervis Line customers traveling to Campbell Hall, Middletown, Otisville and Port Jervis: Take Hudson Line train service to Beacon Station for connecting bus service to Campbell Hall, Middletown, Otisville and Port Jervis. Buses will meet trains departing Grand Central Terminal between 3:48 PM and 8:29 PM. Metro-North is honoring all Pascack Valley and Port Jervis Line rail tickets until further notice. For schedule information go to: http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm . For Friday, September 30, an alternate service plan is being developed and customers should stay connected with us for the latest updates by visiting www.mta.info/mnr

Overnight Lane and Intermittent Full Closures at Robert F. Kennedy Bridge/Bronx Span

Up to two lanes will be closed overnight on the Bronx span of the Robert F. Kennedy Bridge in the Queens/Manhattan-bound direction, starting Monday, September 26, and nightly through Friday, September 30, 2016. The closures are required to perform maintenance on the overhead sign structure. During these weeknights, two lanes (out of four), traveling Queens- and Manhattan-bound, will be closed on the Bronx span from 10:00 p.m. through 5:00 a.m. In addition, beginning Wednesday night 9/28 there will be intermittent full closures of the bridge's Bronx span in Queens- and Manhattan-bound direction required for 15-minute durations for crane operations. This work is extremely weather-dependent and may be postponed until next week in the event of rain or high winds. Motorists should expect delays and plan accordingly, or use an alternate route, during these weeknight periods. Motorists can sign up for MTA e-mail or text alerts at www.mta.info and check the Bridges and Tunnels homepage or Facebook page for the latest information on this planned work.

Southbound customers traveling to Melrose station will be provided with connecting bus service from Tremont to Melrose. For all southbound customers at Melrose Station buses will be provided to Tremont for connecting train service. Baldwin Station Escalator Replacement to Start 9/7

After the morning rush on Wednesday, September 7th, a new escalator is being installed at Baldwin Station. The adjacent staircase is also being refurbished. Customers should use the stairs at the west end of the station at Grand Avenue or the staircase and elevator east of the station building. The project is expected to be completed by the end of the year. Thank you for your patience and understanding while we perform this work.

Restoration of PM Two-Way at HLC - 06 September 2016

On Tuesday, 06 September 2016, two-way operations will resume at the Hugh L. Carey Tunnel during PM Rush Hours. HLC Tunnel PM two-way operations will be in effect from Monday through Friday from 4:30pm through 7:00pm. During these times, three lanes of the tunnel will travel to Brooklyn and one lane will travel to Manhattan. Motorists are advised to adjust their travel plans accordingly.

Metro-North Labor Day Holiday Weekend Service (Friday, Sept. 2- Monday, Sept. 5)

West-of-Hudson Labor Day Holiday Weekend Service (Friday, Sept. 2- Monday, Sept. 5)

You shouldn't have to work hard to celebrate Labor Day! We've got plenty of service to get you where you need to go for the entire holiday weekend (Sept. 2-Sept. 5). On Friday, Sept 2 look for early getaway service on the Port Jervis & Pascack Valley lines. On Saturday, September 3 & Sunday, September 4, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m., making all stops through Suffern, then run express to Secaucus Junction and Hoboken. On Friday, Sept 2 look for early getaway service on the Port Jervis & Pascack Valley lines. On Saturday, September 3 & Sunday, September 4, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 5, Labor Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect on the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines. Restoration of PM Two-Way at HLC - 06 September 2016

On Tuesday, 06 September 2016, two-way operations will resume at the Hugh L. Carey Tunnel during PM Rush Hours. HLC Tunnel PM two-way operations will be in effect from Monday through Friday from 4:30pm through 7:00pm. During these times, three lanes of the tunnel will travel to Brooklyn and one lane will travel to Manhattan. Motorists are advised to adjust their travel plans accordingly.
LIRR Cannonball Express Service to Hamptons

The Cannonball, the LIRR's non-stop express train to the Hamptons operates today, departing Penn Station at 4:06 PM. All luggage MUST fit in the overhead rack or under the seat. Luggage MUST not block aisles or doors. Please listen to announcements or check departure boards for final track assignment. Hamptons Reserve customers on the Cannonball please board on the first three cars of the train. If departing from Track 19, use the staircase to the left of the last LIRR ticket window. See map at http://web.mta.info/lirr/hamptons/HamptonsReservePennMap.jpg

West-of-Hudson Labor Day Holiday Weekend Service (Friday, Sept. 2- Monday, Sept. 5)

You shouldn't have to work hard to celebrate Labor Day! We've got plenty of service to get you where you need to go for the entire holiday weekend (Sept. 2-Sept. 5). On Friday, Sept 2 look for early getaway service on the Port Jervis & Pascack Valley lines. On Saturday, September 3 & Sunday, September 4, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 5, Labor Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect on the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m., making all stops through Suffern, then run express to Secaucus Junction and Hoboken. Customers wishing to travel to Penn Station-NY should transfer at Secaucus Junction. See full details at http://bit.ly/1sXkvxu

West-of-Hudson Labor Day Holiday Weekend Service (Friday, Sept. 2- Monday, Sept. 5)

You shouldn't have to work hard to celebrate Labor Day! We've got plenty of service to get you where you need to go for the entire holiday weekend (Sept. 2-Sept. 5). On Friday, Sept 2 look for early getaway service on the Port Jervis & Pascack Valley lines. On Saturday, September 3 & Sunday, September 4, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 5, Labor Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect on the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m., making all stops through Suffern, then run express to Secaucus Junction and Hoboken. Customers wishing to travel to Penn Station-NY should transfer at Secaucus Junction. See full details at http://bit.ly/1sXkvxu

West-of-Hudson Labor Day Holiday Weekend Service (Friday, Sept. 2- Monday, Sept. 5)

You shouldn't have to work hard to celebrate Labor Day! We've got plenty of service to get you where you need to go for the entire holiday weekend (Sept. 2-Sept. 5). On Friday, Sept 2 look for early getaway service on the Port Jervis & Pascack Valley lines. On Saturday, September 3 & Sunday, September 4, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 5, Labor Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect on the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m., making all stops through Suffern, then run express to Secaucus Junction and Hoboken. Customers wishing to travel to Penn Station-NY should transfer at Secaucus Junction. See full details at http://bit.ly/1sXkvxu
Metro-North Labor Day Holiday Weekend Service (Friday, Sept. 2- Monday, Sept. 5)

You shouldn't have to work hard to celebrate Labor Day! Metro-North has plenty of trains to get you to your destinations during the long holiday weekend (Sept. 2 - Sept. 5). On Friday, Sept. 2, we have early Getaway trains starting at 1 PM. On Saturday, Sept. 3 & Sunday, Sept. 4, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 5, Labor Day, a Sunday schedule will be in effect. See full details at http://bit.ly/1kY170N
